featured.text: But it later turned out that it was exactly his courage to “rebel” and to express his own ideas that marks his films with distinct creativity.
It is not exactly what a child eats that truly matters, but how much time it stays in his mouth.
By this time the cook was angry and decided to do exactly what the dinner guest wanted: slice the potatoes as thin as possible.
I’m not sure exactly how much scholarship you’ll receive, but it will _____ cover your major expenses.
The police had to count on him to find out exactly how the accident happened.

other.text: The success of the park is exactly what Morgan intended to achieve.

In order to know exactly how zebrafish retina is regenerated, the team looked at the neurotransmitter gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA), a chemical messenger in the brain that reduces the activity of neurons.
15 decades of investigation, there is no consensus on exactly what causes the beautiful and mysterious phenomenon of crown shyness.

definition.en_def: In a precise manner; without any ambiguity.
definition.example: She knew exactly what to say in the meeting.
